page.title: 12RELIGION IN CRANHAM
page.content: The{PARISH CHURCH OF ST LAURENCE A church has stood on or near the present site of Corbet's Tey Road for over 1000 years. The oldest part is the tower built around 1200.{ST LUKE'S is another well attended Anglican church. The Roman Catholic Church of{ST {JOSEPH'S}stood in Sunnyside Gardens until moving to St Mary's Lane in 1931. The{UNITED REFORM CHURCH}dates from 1800. It moved to its present position at the corner of Branfil Road in 1911. By 1848 there was a{METHODIST CHURCH opened their building in Hall Lane in 1923. The{BAPTIST CHURCH}was built at the corner of Springfield Gardens in 1935.
